intro: Horminum coccineum, commonly known as the red horminum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Horminum coccineum is often found in woodland areas and along streambanks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the ecosystem.
